result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jesus R Salinas in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Defendant Jesus R Salinas in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  State recommends 3 yrs wps and 3 yrs ES  conc. with 14CF1704  PSI has been reviewed by all parties.  Defense argues.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  Father speaks on his sons behalf.

BTC: 14cf1443 and 14CF1704:  6 yrs 3/3 stayed 3 yrs prob  14CF1642  DRI

no contact with victim, student  GMC
no alco

must work with parents and new doctor and assorsor for mental health issues

CC and supervision fees

May not reenroll in RC Unified but may enroll in the satelite school recommended in the PSI if he qualifies and if the satelite school still exists.
Anger Management and LIfe Skills programs.
DNA sample and pay the surcharge
7 pm curfew for the next 90 days.  You may leave the home in presence of mother after 7 pm.
take meds as prescribed.  Take no other Controlled substances, only those prescribed by dr.
90 days RCJ for enforcement purposes.  CFTS will only apply to prison sentence.
GPS or SCRAM at the recommendation of the agent.
